Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a red-brown ribbed pottery vessel, the fabric is black in section, the interior is covered with a dark-brown resinous deposit, the exterior is covered with a red-brown slip and remains of three lines of Coptic text written in black ink, now faded in parts, containing a receipt.
Bibliographic references: Crum & Bell 1922 / Wadi Sarga: Coptic and Greek texts (p.174)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (36394) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/36394)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: O.Sarga 251 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
